page.title: 12RECREATION
page.content: There are several recreational sites within this area;they range from a park to a museum. The park is used for several sports: the major one being rugby.Abertillery R.F.C. use the centre of the stadium. There are also tennis courts,a bowling green and football pitches.The stadium has a cycle track and is used for youth internationals in both rugby and soccer as well as for the local school sports and carnival. The museum is situated under the library and is run by volunteers and has no governmental support.It is open on three afternoons a week or by appointment and is concerned with the local history of Abertillery. The library,built in 1970,replaced an earlier building and is open week.It houses 30,000 books and has a reference section.
